roleset.name: to cut or tear with or as if with the teeth, nom/partitive-quant
roleset.note: BITE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bite' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from bite.01-v predicate notes)

BITE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry bite.01, OntoNotes grouping bite-n senses 3, 5, 6, 8; maps to VN classes hurt-40.8.3-2 (membership in this class seems very dubious to me...) and swat-18.2. Framed by Claire. (from bite.01-n)

example.name: arbitrary subject
example.text: Says [*ICH*-1] another lawyer : `` The practice of law is a matter of [*]biting one 's lip when you live in a small community [*T*-2] .
example.arg: when you live in a small community [*T*-2]

example.name: transitive
example.text: He bites it , scowls and throws it down . ``

example.name: passive
example.text: When it comes to money [*T*-1] : Once [*-3]bitten [*-2] , [*] 2,000 times shy .

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: Mary gave John a bite of her dessert.

example.name: Arg 1 only, with "on" PP
example.text: The fisherman felt a bite on his line.

example.name: Arg 0, flavor domain
example.text: John enjoys the bite of southeast Asian cuisine.

example.name: Arg 0 as possessor
example.text: That dog's bark is worse than his bite.

example.name: Metaphorical bite, all arguments
example.text: Pattinson enjoys his bite of 'Twilight' fame.
